why_choose.title: üåü Why PC Community is Chosen?
why_choose.subtitle: Outstanding track record and comprehensive support system

reliable_scale.title: üìä Reliable Scale
reliable_scale.description: A large-scale community with over 1,500 active members. Someone with specialized knowledge will answer any question.

resolution_power.title: ‚ö° Amazing Problem-Solving Power
resolution_power.description: Boasting a 90%+ resolution rate for questions! Many members with specialized knowledge provide accurate advice.

wide_support.title: üéØ Wide Support Range
wide_support.description: From programming consultation to PC building, customization, and troubleshooting, we support everyone from beginners to experts.

support_system.title: üõ†Ô∏è Comprehensive Support System Friendly to Beginners
support_system.subtitle: Mechanisms that support efficient learning and growth

question_forum.title: üìã Question Forum System
question_forum.description: We have dedicated question forums to create an environment for efficient problem-solving. Following the question guidelines, you can expect more appropriate and faster responses.

best_answer.title: üèÜ Best Answer Role System
best_answer.description: Members who consistently provide excellent answers receive a 'Best Answer Role'. This system makes reliable answerers easily identifiable.

research_culture.title: üìö 'Research Before Asking' Culture
research_culture.description: A healthy learning environment where you can grow while developing your research skills. Plenty of hints are available when you're stuck.

community_benefits.title: üéâ Community-Exclusive Benefits
community_benefits.subtitle: Not just learning, but enjoyable community life

events.title: üé™ Rich Events
events.description: Events are held irregularly! Suggestions from members are also welcome, and your ideas might come to life.

close_distance.title: ü§ù Close Distance with Management
close_distance.description: Short distance between moderators and members, creating a casual atmosphere for consultation. Face-to-face support and suggestion forms are also available.

friendly_environment.title: üåà Friendly and Peaceful Environment
friendly_environment.description: PC Community prides itself on 'peaceful and kind members'. Even beginners can ask questions without hesitation in a warm atmosphere.

target_audience.title: üöÄ Recommended for These People!
target_audience.subtitle: Do any of these apply to you?
target_audience.programming_beginner: Programming beginners who want to learn from the basics
target_audience.pc_builder_title: People Who Want to Try PC Building
target_audience.pc_builder: People who want to try PC building but feel anxious
target_audience.advanced_discussion_title: Advanced Users Who Want Technical Discussions
target_audience.advanced_discussion: Advanced users who want to enjoy technical discussions
target_audience.troubleshooting: People who need help with troubleshooting
target_audience.community: People who want to connect with like-minded individuals
target_audience.latest_tech_title: People Who Want to Keep Up with Latest Tech
target_audience.latest_tech: People who want to keep up with the latest technology

important_notice.title: üí° Important Information Before Joining
important_notice.description1: Participation requires a Discord account that is 14 days or older. For new accounts, please join again after 14 days have passed.
important_notice.description2: ‚ÄªIf your account is less than 14 days old, you will be timed out until 14 days have passed.
important_notice.description3: This is an anti-trolling measure to maintain a safer and more comfortable community environment.

rules.title: Community Rules
rules.description: Rules for everyone to enjoy comfortably

admin_support.title: Admin Support
admin_support.description: Report problems or requests to administrators

items.title: Beginner Friendly
items.description: Feel free to ask any questions

items.title: Expert Knowledge
items.description: Specialists in various fields are available

links.title: Getting Started
links.description: Please read these before joining the community.

items.title: Community Rules
items.description: Rules to ensure everyone has a comfortable experience

rules.title: Rules
rules.page_description: Rules for everyone to enjoy comfortably. Please read them carefully.

rule1.title: Principle of Mutual Respect
rule1.description: All members should respect each other and interact politely. Aggressive remarks, insults, and discriminatory expressions are prohibited.

rule2.title: Appropriate Channel Usage
rule2.description: Please post according to the purpose of each channel. Questions in question channels, casual chat in chat channels, etc. Choose the appropriate place.

rule3.title: Prohibition of Spam
rule3.description: Please refrain from consecutive posts of the same message, meaningless character strings, and excessive use of emojis.

exceptions.title: About Exceptions
exceptions.description: Exceptions are made for cases related to technical questions or information sharing that benefits the community. Please ask administrators if unsure.

rules_detailed.title: Community Rules
rules_detailed.description: These are the rules to ensure everyone has a comfortable experience. Please read them carefully.

important_notice.title: Important Notice
important_notice.content1: If you break the above rules, we will give you several warnings before banning, but severe violations or obvious trolling may result in immediate bans without warning.
important_notice.content2: If you violate Discord's TOS, you will be banned immediately. Even for actions not mentioned above, management reserves the right to take appropriate measures.

info.title: Detailed Explanation
info.content: Spam activities harm other members' experience. Moderate use of emojis and normal conversation is fine.

rules.title: Keep it SFW!
rules.content1: Within reason, some mild language is acceptable.
rules.content2: If your username/PFP is offensive, you may be asked to change it.

terms.title: Terms Explained
terms.sfw: SFW: Safe for work (content safe for workplace)

bad.title: Content to Avoid
bad.content: Overly aggressive language, inappropriate images, content difficult to view at work

good.title: Appropriate Content
good.content: Constructive discussions, moderate jokes, content anyone can view

rules.title: Use Readable Names!
rules.content: Usernames containing special characters that make mentioning difficult must be changed.

restrictions.title: Restrictions
items: No symbols at the beginning of names
Avoid characters that make mentioning difficult

rules.reason: Readable names facilitate smooth communication and make mentioning and message exchanges smoother.

rules.title: General Conversation Only
rules.content1: Religion, politics, and other negative and aggressive topics are prohibited.
rules.content2: Attempting to start arguments is considered aggressive behavior.
rules.reason: PC Community is intended for technical learning and information exchange. We avoid controversial topics to maintain a constructive and positive environment.

rules.title: No Advertising or Self-Promotion
rules.content1: Links to your own content or channels are prohibited unless permitted or relevant to the conversation flow.
rules.content2: Recruiting for Discord or other communities is strictly prohibited.

exception.title: About Exceptions
exception.content: Sharing relevant links as part of answering technical questions or information sharing is fine. However, it's important that promotion is not the main purpose.

rules.title: Read the Guidelines Before Asking!
rules.content1: Before using the question forum, you must read the question guidelines.
rules.content2: Answering questions that obviously show the guidelines weren't read is also prohibited.
rules.content3: Missing parts should be selected from the embed options posted in the thread before the answerer asks.

importance.title: Importance of Question Guidelines
importance.content: Proper questions lead to faster and more accurate answers. This respects answerers' time and leads to efficient problem-solving.

contact.title: Need Support?
contact.content: If you have questions, don't hesitate to ask our helpful MODs for assistance!

terms.title: Reference Materials
terms.content: Please also check the following for other terms and conditions:

guidelines.title: Question Guidelines
guidelines.description: These guidelines help resolve questions smoothly. Please read them before asking questions.

important_notice.title: Important Notice
important_notice.content1: These guidelines are established to help resolve questions smoothly. Being questioned by answerers means there are deficiencies in your question description.
important_notice.content2: Questions that don't follow the guidelines will be deleted or otherwise handled by moderators.

guidelines.title: Search and Research First
guidelines.content1: Always search on Google or similar before asking questions.
guidelines.content2: Describe what you researched, what you learned, and what you tried.
guidelines.content3: Including links to related sites that weren't helpful helps others understand how your question differs from others.

tips.title: Search Tips
items: Search error messages exactly as they appear

guidelines.title: Write Clear Titles
guidelines.content1: The forum displays your question title and part of the beginning of the details, and many members use this information to decide whether they can answer and if they're interested.
guidelines.content2: If the title is unclear or uninteresting, you may not get answers.

tips.title: How to Write Titles
tips.content: If you're unsure how to write a title, write the title last. Writing the detailed part of the question first sometimes makes it easier to explain the current problem.

examples.title: Good Title Examples
items: About the difference between CPU and GPU

guidelines.title: Write Clear Question Body
guidelines.content: When asking someone something, you need to correctly convey the question content and information needed for answers.

checklist.title: Pre-Question Checklist
items: Is this not an abstract question?
Is it clear what you want to know?
Will others understand it the way you intend?
Is the information needed to answer the question included?

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.content: Without knowing the purpose, we can't suggest alternative solutions.

current_state.title: Current State
current_state.content: What you're currently working on as a solution to your purpose.

good.title: Good Example
good.content: I want to do ‚óã‚óã. For that, I want to do √ó√ó, so what methods are there? Currently I'm ~~

pc_problems.title: For PC Problems
items: Parts: If you know which part is causing problems, specify it
PC Model: If it's a purchased PC, include the model number

programming_problems.title: For Programming Problems
items: Libraries: Libraries installed via pip, npm, etc.

code_formatting.title: How to Format Code
code_formatting.important: Important: Copy and paste errors and code in full text (screenshots make it difficult for answerers to reproduce in their environment)

scraping.title: Scraping Related
scraping.content: Questions and answers about scraping activities on sites that don't explicitly allow it are prohibited
scraping.reason: This is generally not recommended behavior and violates terms of service clauses even when not explicitly prohibited.

questioner.title: For Questioners
questioner.content: Questioners should post a summary of the solution before closing (same for self-resolved cases).

how_to_close.title: How to Close
how_to_close.content: Right-click or long-press the message that led to the solution and select BestAnswer from Apps.

abandoned_threads.title: About Abandoned Threads
abandoned_threads.content: Administrators and moderators may request thread closure:
abandoned_threads.resolved: If resolved: Summarize the thread and close it
abandoned_threads.unresolved: If unresolved: Let us know it's still unresolved
abandoned_threads.weekly_update: Even if permitted by moderators not to close due to circumstances, provide status updates at least weekly.

rules.title: Answering guideline-violating questions is prohibited
rules.content: Encourage questioners to make their questions comply with guidelines

rules.title: Don't treat as closed until the questioner closes it
Respond kindly
rules.content: For posts that don't follow guidelines, kindly paste the guideline link

notes.title: Important Announcements
notes.content1: These guidelines may be changed. You will be notified of any changes.
notes.contact: Questions about these guidelines can be asked here or in Discord.

support.title: Contact Administrators
support.page_description: For violation reports, questions, requests, timeout removal applications, bug reports, etc.
support.login_required: Discord login is required to use this feature.

form.drop_files: Drop files or click to select

404.title: 404 - Page Not Found | PC Community
404.description: The page you're looking for has been deleted or the URL may be incorrect.
404.search_title: Can't find the page you're looking for?

login.title: Contact Administrators
login.content: To use the contact form, please log in with your Discord account.

dialog.label: Request dialogue with administrator
dialog.help: Checking this will create a dedicated channel for direct communication with administrators.

anonymous.label: Request anonymity
anonymous.help: ‚ÄªFor anti-trolling purposes, sender information is stored in PCB but won't be displayed to administrators.

content.label: Content
content.placeholder: Please describe your inquiry in detail (within 800 characters)

attachments.label: Attachments
attachments.paste_info: Images can be pasted with Ctrl+V
attachments.supported_formats: Supported formats: JPG, PNG, PDF, DOC, ZIP

messages.network_error: Submission failed. Please check your network connection.
messages.anonymous_not_available_in_dialog: Anonymous mode is not available in dialog mode
messages.discord_link_not_configured: Discord invite link is not configured. Please contact administrators.
